p: Prophylactic administration of myeloid growth factors has become standard treatment to reduce the incidence of chemotherapy‐induced severe neutropenia, particularly recommended for therapies associated with a ≥20% risk of febrile neutropenia due to both chemotherapy regimen and individual patient risk factors 1, 3, 20. Rolontis is being developed as a novel long‐acting form of G‐CSF that has a distinct structure compared to pegfilgrastim and may represent a more potent new G‐CSF that delivers improved clinical efficacy.
